reviews.review_msg: Nesbit makes lectures engaging and cares about student understanding. Exams require extensive textbook and outside reading, but with resources like Unstuckstudy, the class is manageable.
Nesbit is very passionate about what he teaches. He makes his lectures meaningful and fun. Exams are straightforward. He is very nice and cares about his students.
One of the kindest and most understanding professors I have had. He explains the concepts well and is just overall an amazing professor. He cares a lot about his students.

Nesbit really cared for his students' understanding of course concepts and his lectures were really interesting. The assignments were not too difficult but did require a lot of reading from the textbook and a bunch of other sources so keep that in mind. Midterm and final were not too difficult, but study the textbook and review the slides!!!

This class was so hard for no reason. Take this class with any other prof and you should be fine  cause this prof makes you memorize so much for the tests (I would memorize like 200 terms per test) and the essay was so much work like 2500 words with like 12 sources.

I love the hustle on the day of our exam. John was running up and down the aisle's making sure we had our scantron and exam paper. I was truly inspired by his efficiency and the speed in which he navigated the lecture hall. His voice is second to none, very engaging and, dare I say, melodic. W Rizz. Funny guy too, would love to grab drinks with him
N/A
he is an amazing and generous prof

He is honestly such a sweetheart. I do agree his lectures might be boring and he may talk about irrelevant concepts but he is such a generous professor. He would go to any length to help his student. We flunked our final exam and he gave us bonus marks so we don't fall under a C- grade.

He is a kind prof, and he is always ready to help. The paper of this course is not easy, and the lecture is not always engaging. However, finishing the reading, participating the tutorials, and reviewing slides make it possible for students to learn a lot and pass. The textbook required, and the digital version is accessible online.

HONESTLY, the only professor that I had who actually cared about their students this semester, having COVID. He gave us 5 extra bonus points as we did not do as well on the final to MATCH the average of the in class final. VERY thoughtful. Before COVID (the midterm) was actually very fair as well. STUDY THE TEXTBOOK.

Dr. Nesbit is absolutely incredible. His are some of the best university lectures I have experienced, as they are very engaging and contain relevant, valuable, and thought provoking information. His teaching and expectations are clear, helpful, fair, and informative. Concepts learned will stay with you long term, and will be useful in the future.

Only heard from the prof when he came in to say hi during the midterm, didn't show up for the final. course could have been better if I had a different ta. she was very on top of due dates, however (mariah) was an extremely tough grader and marked unfairly. she marked every written assignment in less then an hr ver explained what was done wrong
He was very understanding in terms of possible obstacles in coming to class (bus strike), and he gave good examples in lectures that help students understand the material more.

He's okay, but sometimes he forgets what he's saying and takes a couple of seconds. Also, I don't find him very engaging, I think he is on the boring side. He really makes those 50 minute lectures feel like 2 hours.

John is a wonderful human and professor. But I had an immense problem with one of his TA instructors who penalized students unfairly to the point of John having to intervene. I hope she was removed from her position. If not, you'll know who she is upon receiving your first few assignments back. Also, PLEASE study the ENTIRE textbook in detail!

Took the course online and yes, the 3 discussion posts a week were annoying but manageable. Essays are easy (based on discussion posts) and graded fairly. The midterm and final honestly weren't that bad- lots of definitions but it was like basically any other psychology course midterm (but I'm a psych minor so I guess I'm used to that)

Took educ 220 online, the class is quite difficult. Discussion posts were tedious and required you to post 3 posts on 3 different days to get full marks. who has time for that? Also, midterm exam was very difficult and the practice quizzes were irrelevant to the midterm. AVOID THIS CLASS!
An extremely boring, slow, and monotone talker. Uses the class for his research. Teaches about teaching but is the most boring professor i've ever had.

Overall I did not think the class was that bad, but that said I rarely went, but still managed to pull of a good grade. John seems like a really nice guy, and while he may be "boring" he does know his stuff and seems very receptive to student criticisim.

SUPER NICE. If you ask questions she'll make it clear. She's very willing to help any way she can. I don't know why other people gave her so much negative reviews because it's really hard not to like her.

Not a VERY interesting course, loaded with concepts. We are expected to memorize nearly everything in the textbook. The course is very heavy!! Thought the prof wants to be funny with his jokes, but apparently not seem funny to me. Overall, need to work hard to get an A.

Lectures were packed with information but enjoyable, Dr. Sugarman is great at engaging the class even in a large lecture setting. Textbook reading is a necessity, the midterm and final are solely multiple choice and you will not pass with only attending lectures. The tests are daunting, worth a lot with not a lot of questions so be sure to review.

His lectures are amazing and I would definitely take another class with him again! His exams are all MC and you will do fine if you just study his notes in the lecture slides. The two papers we had to write weren't too bad, but the first one is harder than the second one.

His lectures are wonderful and eye opening. Voice is clear, never confusing. Midterm and Final are all multiple choice ( on the lecture and textbook). There is  a lot of reading and info to memorize ( many theories). There are 2 papers to write ( they were okay for me, based on the textbook).  Overall, understand and read the textbook.
Dope class... extremely fun and interesting class. Totally recommend this class to anyone.
definatley wish there were more profs around like him!!!!
great prof, made class fun and aint a bad bball player
No Comments
good lectures, interesting and personable
Gives clear direction, and helpful feedback. Knows his subject and is pleasant.
Very helpful and knowledgable. Always provides useful feedback.

Alissa is easily the most convoluted and frustrating professor I have ever had.  Assignments that should be straight-forward are made extremely complicated for no reason at all.  Deadlines and marks breakdowns change constantly.  Totally biased against the public education system, and essentially discourages you from wanting to be a teacher.
